intro: Tordylium persicum, commonly known as Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tordylium persicum is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
